candidates.name: Richard Shelby
candidates.bio: Richard Shelby was born in Birmingham Alabama. He obtained his undergraduate degree, law degree and his Juris Doctorin in Alabama. Shelby was elected to Alabama Senate in 1970 and then he won the United States Senate election in Alabama in 1986.
candidates.platform1: Supported letting unborn child to be elibile for state health insurance program.
candidates.platform2: Supported notifying parents of minor of out-of-state abortion.

candidates.name: Lisa Murkowski
candidates.bio: Lisa Murkowski majored in economicas in Georgetown University. During the same period of time, her father, Frank Murkowski was the senator of Alaska. She assummed office in 2002 and helped the protect the health care of the Alaska Native Tribe.
candidates.platform2: Opposed to gun control.

candidates.name: John McCain
candidates.bio: John McCain was born at a Naval Air Station in the Panama Canal Zone. His family were military officials and he followed suit. He was a Naval pilot during the Vietnam war when he was captured after ejecting from the aircraft. After torture and returning to the United States, he became interested in politics. He ran for presidency in 2008.
candidates.platform2: Opposed to gun control.
candidates.platform3: Supported Native Americans live and deveplop land.

candidates.name: John Boozman
candidates.bio: John Boozman was born in Shreveport, Louisiana and attended the University of Arkansas. He won in a U.S House of Representative sepcial election when his predcessor resigned. He voted in favor of the Iraq Resolution that lead to the Iraq war. He became a senator after winning the 2010 senator election
candidates.platform2: Opposed the Paycheck Fairiness Act.

candidates.name: Kamala Harris
candidates.bio: Kamala Harris was born in Oakland, California and attended the Harvard University. She was elected Attorney General of California in 2010. When U.S. Senator Barbara Boxer announced her retirement, Harris decided to run for U.S. Senate
candidates.platform2: Supported and introduced the California Homeowner's Bill of Rights.

candidates.name: Michael Bennet
candidates.bio: Michael Bennet was born in New Delhi, India and attended the Wesleyan and Yale University. Benne was appointed superintendent of Denver Public Schools and advised Barack Obama on education issues. He was appointed in the US Senate by Colorado Governor Bill Ritter and Bennet seek US Senate election in 2010 and won.
candidates.platform2: Supported immigration Reform.
candidates.platform3: Supported research of alternative energy sources.

candidates.name: Richard Blumenthal
candidates.bio: Richard Blumenthal was born in Brooklyn, New York and attended University of Cambridge. He enlisted during the Vietnam War and received an honorable discharge. Blumenthal was elected Attorney General in 1990 and was elected into US Senate in 2010.
candidates.platform2: Supported Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act.
candidates.platform3: Supported anti-gay discrimination based on gender.

candidates.name: Ron DeSantis
candidates.bio: DeSantis was born in Jacksonville, Florida and attended Yale University. DeSantis was elected into the US House of Representatives in 2012. He introduced the Faithful Execution of Law Act of 2014.
candidates.platform1: Opposed any raise of taxes for Global Warming
candidates.platform2: Opposed terrorism.

candidates.name: Johnny Isakson
candidates.bio: Johnny Isakson was born in Atlanta, Georgia. Isakson was elected into the Georgia House of Representatives in 1976 and stayed for seven terms. Isakson was selected into the US House of Representatives in 1999 in a sepcial election. Isakson was elected US Senator for Georgia in 2004.
candidates.platform1: Supported tougher border security to limit illegal immigration.
candidates.platform2: Supported forbidding human cloning.

candidates.name: Brian Schatz
candidates.bio: Schatz was born in Ann Arbor, Michigan and attended Pomona College. Schatz was elected into the Hawaii House of Representatives in 1998. Schatz won the special election for US Senate in 2014.
candidates.platform2: Supported same-sex marriage.
candidates.platform3: Supported expand background checks for gun purchases.

candidates.name: Mike Crapo
candidates.bio: Capo was born in Idaho Falls, Idaho and attended Brigham Young University and Harvard Law School. He ran for state senate in 1982 and served until 1992. He was elected into the US House of Representatives in 1992. Crapo was elected to the U.S. Senate in 1998.
candidates.platform2: Opposed expanding background checks for gun buyers

candidates.name: Mark Kirk
candidates.bio: Kirk was born in Champaign, Illinois and attended cornell University. He enlisted into the military as an intelligence officer. Then, he joined the U.S. House of Representatives in 2000. In 2010, he won the U.S. Senate elction.
candidates.platform2: Opposed corrupted officials
candidates.platform3: Supported re-authorization of Violence Against Women Act.

candidates.name: Baron Hill
candidates.bio: Baron Hill was a member of the Indiana House of Representatives from 1982 to 1990. He was also a member of the Blue Dog Coalition. He owns a lobbying firm that represents Cook Industries.
candidates.platform1: Supported marriage rights regardless of gender.
candidates.platform2: Supported the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.

candidates.name: Chuck Grassley
candidates.bio: Chuck Grassley was born in New Harford, Iowa and attnded Iowa State Teachers College. He was elected into the U.S. Senate in 1980. Grassley pushed for increasing the level of taxation on American citizens living aboard.
candidates.platform2: Opposed to Obama HealthCare Act.

candidates.name: Jerry Moran
candidates.bio: Jerry Moran was born in Great Bend, Kansas and attended University of Kansas. He was elected into the U.S. House of Representatives in 1996. He ran and was elected to the U.S. Senate in 2010.
candidates.platform2: Opposed to Obama HealthCare Act.

candidates.name: Rand Paul
candidates.bio: Rand Paul was born in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and attended Baylor University and Duke University. After completing his residency in ophthalmology, he moved to Kentucky. Due to his father's, U.S. Senator Phil Gramm's, influence and political supporters, Paul ran for U.S. Senate in 2010 and was elected.
candidates.platform1: Supported cutting federal spending by reduncing international aid.
candidates.platform2: Opposed to bailing out Detriot after bankruptcy.
candidates.platform3: Opposed the use of drones within the United States.

candidates.name: Charles Boustany
candidates.bio: Charles Boustany was born in Lafayette, Louisiana and attended University of Louisiana at Lafayette. Boustany was elected into the U.S. House of Representatives in 2004. He purchase a bogus European title from fraudsters;
candidates.platform2: Supported the United States farm bill.
candidates.platform3: Supported cleaning up undetonated cluster bombs

candidates.name: Donna Edwards
candidates.bio: Edwards was born in Yanceyville, North Carolina and attended the University of New Hampshire School of Law. Edwards co-founded and serve as the first executive director of the National Network to End Domestic Violence. In 2008, Edwards was elected into the U.S. House of Representative.
candidates.platform1: Supported and advocated for women in domestic violence.
candidates.platform2: Supported getting a living wage for working people.

candidates.name: Roy Blunt
candidates.bio: Roy Blunt was born in Niangua, Missouri and attended Missouri State University. In 1984, Blunt became the Secretary of State for Missouri. Blunt was elected into the U.S. House of  Representatives in 1998. In 2010, Blunt was elected to be a U.S. senator.
candidates.platform1: Opposed the HealthCare Reform by democrates.
candidates.platform2: Opposed lawsuit against gun manufactures and dealers if they sold a gun used for violence later.
candidates.platform3: Supported drilling oil on the U.S. coastline.

candidates.name: Catherine Cortez Masto
candidates.bio: Cortez Masto was born in Las Vegas, Nevada and attended University of Nevada, Reno. Cortez Masto is a Nevada Attorney General and her office began investigating Bank of America for raising interest on borrowers. Cortez Masto was endorsed by retiring U.S. Senator Harry Reid as successor.
candidates.platform2: Supported the raise of minimum wage.
candidates.platform3: Supported immigration and wants pathway for unodcumented immigrants to citizenship.

candidates.name: Kelly Ayotte
candidates.bio: Ayotte was born in Nashua, New Hampshire and attended Pennsylvania State University. Ayotte became New Hampshire Attorney General in 1998. Ayotte was elected into U.S. Senate when her predcessor retired.
candidates.platform1: Supported the right to bear arms.
candidates.platform2: Supported perserving the environment.

candidates.name: Chuck Schumer
candidates.bio: Schumer was born in Brooklyn, New York and he attended Harvard College. Schumer was elected into the New York State Assembly in 1974. IN 1998, he aws elected into the U.S. Senate.
candidates.platform2: Supported President Barack Obama's Health Reform

candidates.name: Richard Burr
candidates.bio: Burr was born in Charlottesvile, Virginia and attended Wake Forest University. Blurr worked 17 years as a sales manager before he joined the U.S. House of Representatives in 1992. In 2004, Blurr was elected into the U.S. Senate.
candidates.platform1: Supported the right to bear arms.
candidates.platform2: Supported for the reautorization of the Violence Against Women Act
candidates.platform3: Opposed the regulation of the tobacco industry by U.S. Food and Drug Administration.

candidates.name: John Hoeven
candidates.bio: Hoeven was born in Bismarck, North Dakota and attended Dartmouth College. Hoeven was a banker before he was elected to be the Governor of North Dakota in 2000. Hoeven was elected into U.S. Senate in 2010.
candidates.platform2: Supported pro-life

candidates.name: Rob Portman
candidates.bio: Portman was born in Cincinnati, Ohio and attended Darthmouth College. Portman became a White House Counsel in 1989. In 1993, Portman was elected into the U.S. House of  Representatives. He won the U.S. Senate election in 2010.
candidates.platform2: opposed the Law of Sea Treaty

candidates.name: James Lankford
candidates.bio: Lankford was born in Dallas, Texas and attended University of Texas at Austin. Post graudation, Lankford became the program director for a Christan camp. Lankford was elected into the U.S. House of Representatives in 2010. He was also elected into the U.S. Senate through a special election in 2014.
candidates.platform2: Oppsed abortion.

candidates.name: Ron Wyden
candidates.bio: Wyden was born in Wichita, Kansas and attended Stanford University. Wyden was a professor teaching gerotology before he ran for the U.S. House of Representatives in 1980. He was elected to U.S. Senate in 1996.
candidates.platform2: Supported legal abortion.

candidates.name: Pat Toomey
candidates.bio: Toomey was born in Providence, Rhode Island and attended Harvard College. Toomey worked in the bank before he was elected into the U.S. House of Representatives in 1998. Toomey did not run again in 2004 because he vowed to serve only three terms. Therefore, he ran for U.S. Senate in 2004 but was defeated. He won the U.S. Senate election in 2010.
candidates.platform2: Supported the icnrease of charter schools.

candidates.name: Tim Scott
candidates.bio: Scott was born in North Charleston, South Carolina and attended Presbyterain College. Scott owns an insurance agency. He was involved in the Charleston County Council, South Carolina House of Representatives and U.S. House of Representatives before he ran for U.S. Senate in a special election in 2014. Scott is the first African American to serve as U.S. Senator from South Carolina.
candidates.platform1: Supported the decrease of federal spending and taxes.
candidates.platform2: Opposed the 2010 health care reform law.

candidates.name: John Thune
candidates.bio: Thune was born in Murdo, South Dakota and attended Biola University. He worked as a legistlative aide till he ran for U.S. House of Representatives in 1997. Eventually, Thune ran for U.S. Senate in 2005 and won.
candidates.platform2: Supported to increase of veterans' benefit.
candidates.platform3: Supported development of alternative energy sources.

candidates.name: Mike Lee
candidates.bio: Lee was born in Mesa, Arizona and attend Brigham Young University. Lee served as a law clerk before he was elected into the U.S. Senate in 2010. Lee strongly believes the importance of being able to express his political views since childhood.
candidates.platform1: Supported reducing tax for foreign earnings.
candidates.platform2: Supported wild-fire prevention projects.

candidates.name: Patrick Leahy
candidates.bio: Leahy was born in Montpelier, Vermont and attend Saint Michael's College. Leahy was elected into U.S. Senate in 1974. He was the first non-Republican Senator from Vermont since mid-19tth century.
candidates.platform2: Supported using alternative energy sources.

candidates.name: Patty Murray
candidates.bio: Murray was born in Bothell, Washington and attended Washington State University. Murray was a lobbyist for environmental and educational issues. She was elected into U.S. Senate in 1993.
candidates.platform2: Supported improve border security and punishment for illegal immigrants.
candidates.platform3: Supported providing healthcare access to women.

candidates.name: Ron Johnson
candidates.bio: Johnson was born in Mankato, Minnesota and attended Univesristy of Minnesota. Johnson worked at PACUR and eventually became the CEO. He was elected to the U.S. SEnate in 2010.
candidates.platform2: Opposed Affordable Care Act.
